response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Anagram Finder\", \"description\": \"Write a function `anagrams` that takes a list of strings as input and returns all anagrams within the list.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```\\ndef anagrams(strings: list[str]) -> set[tuple[str]]:\\n``` \\n\\n#### Input\\n- `strings` (list[str]): A list of strings.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a set of tuples, where each tuple contains two strings that are anagrams of each other.\\n\", \"code\": \"from collections import Counter\\n\\ndef anagrams(strings: list[str]) -> set[tuple[str]]:\\n    result = set()\\n    for i in range(len(strings)):\\n        for j in range(i+1, len(strings)):\\n            if sorted(strings[i]) == sorted(strings[j]):\\n                result.add((strings[i], strings[j]))\\n    return result\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert 'anagrams' in str(anagrams(['cat', 'dog', 'god', 'act', 'tac'])), \", \"assert len(list(anagrams(['hello', 'olleh', 'world'])))) == 2, \"] }"
